gui.controller

Class ParkEntranceScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.controller.ParkEntranceScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IThreadController, javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class ParkEntranceScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, IThreadController
    Controller class for the park entrance screen in a theme park management system. This class handles the functionality related to the park entrance, including displaying and updating the list of current orders, entering and exiting the park, handling new visits, and managing order statuses. Implements Initializable for initialization logic and IThreadController for handling thread-related tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Initializes the controller class. This method is automatically called after the fxml file has been loaded. It sets up the UI components and starts the background update task.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

      • setupTable

        private void setupTable()
        Initializes the table columns and sets up custom rendering for the status column. This method also prepares the table to display orders and their statuses, highlighting orders that are currently "In Park" in green, and others in red.

      • startBackgroundUpdateTask

        private void startBackgroundUpdateTask()
        Starts a background task that updates the list of orders at fixed intervals. This ensures the displayed information is kept current without requiring manual refreshes.

      • updateOrdersList

        private void updateOrdersList()
        Updates the orders list by fetching the latest data and refreshing the table view. This method is meant to be called periodically or when data needs to be refreshed.

      • onEnterParkClicked

        public void onEnterParkClicked()
        Handles the action to mark an order as entered into the park. If necessary, it initiates a payment process for unpaid orders before updating the status. Displays appropriate messages for errors or validation failures.

      • onNewVisitClicked

        public void onNewVisitClicked()
        Initiates the process to handle a new occasional visit. This method transitions the user interface to facilitate the registration of an on-the-spot park visit.

      • onNotArrivedClicked

        public void onNotArrivedClicked()
        Marks a selected order as not arrived if it surpasses the estimated entry time. It validates the selection and ensures that only applicable orders can be marked as such. Displays appropriate error messages for invalid selections.

      • onExitParkClicked

        public void onExitParkClicked()
        Handles the action to mark an order as having exited the park. Updates the order status to "Completed" and ensures that only orders currently marked as "In Park" can be updated. Displays error messages for invalid selections or operations.

      • hideErrorMessage

        private void hideErrorMessage()
        Hides the error message section of the UI. This method is used to clear any previously displayed error messages when they are no longer relevant.

      • showErrorMessage

        private void showErrorMessage(java.lang.String error)
        Displays an error message on the UI. This method makes the error message section visible and updates its content with the provided message.
        Parameters:
        error - The error message to be displayed.

      • calculatePriceByOrderType

        private double calculatePriceByOrderType(logic.Order order)
        Calculates the price at entrance based on the order type and applicable discounts. This method takes into account the number of visitors and the specific discounts for each order type.
        Parameters:
        order - The order for which to calculate the entrance price.
        Returns:
        The calculated price after applying the appropriate discounts.

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
        Cleans up resources or threads when the controller is closed or navigated away from. This method ensures that background tasks are properly terminated to avoid memory leaks.
        Specified by:
        cleanUp in interface IThreadController
